sentences.en: But there is disenchantment with markets in Colombia, even though the country all but escaped recession.
sentences.cn: 但在哥伦比亚很多民众对于市场不再抱持幻想, 即使该国几乎躲开了经济衰退.

sentences.en: It also revealed a growing disenchantment with all that their fame had produced.
sentences.cn: 这张专辑也显示出披头四已不再沉醉于成名所带来的一切.

sentences.en: There is growing public disenchantment with the educational system.
sentences.cn: 公众对教育制度越来越感到希望幻灭。

sentences.en: This glittering dust they produce differs from the components normally acquired by a disenchantment spell.
sentences.cn: 这种方法所获得的粉末与普通的分解法术所获得的材料是不同的.

sentences.en: When those idols are found to have feet of clay, the pain of disenchantment can be profound.
sentences.cn: 当人们发现那些偶像有严重的缺陷时，会产生无比痛苦的失落感。

sentences.en: Yet that decision may merely aggravate voters'disenchantment with the EU.
sentences.cn: 然而这一决定或许只会让选民对于欧盟更加不抱幻想.

words.tran_cn: 不再着迷的；不再抱幻想的；感到幻灭的
使不再着迷（disenchant的过去分词）

trans.tran_en: Disenchantment is the feeling of being disappointed with something, and no longer believing that it is good or worthwhile
